# MBC CQRS Serverless Framework

> A comprehensive CQRS (Command Query Responsibility Segregation) framework for building serverless applications on AWS, powered by NestJS and TypeScript.

## Overview

MBC CQRS Serverless is a monorepo providing a complete framework for implementing event-driven, serverless architectures using:

- NestJS v10.x with TypeScript (ES2021)
- AWS Lambda, DynamoDB, SNS/SQS, Cognito, API Gateway, AppSync
- CQRS pattern with event sourcing
- Multi-tenant data isolation
- Lerna v8.x monorepo management

## Documentation

- Full Documentation: https://mbc-cqrs-serverless.mbc-net.com/
- Getting Started: https://mbc-cqrs-serverless.mbc-net.com/docs/getting-started
- CLI Reference: https://mbc-cqrs-serverless.mbc-net.com/docs/cli

## Packages

- @mbc-cqrs-serverless/core: Main CQRS framework with AWS integrations
- @mbc-cqrs-serverless/cli: CLI scaffolding tool for project creation
- @mbc-cqrs-serverless/master: Master data management
- @mbc-cqrs-serverless/sequence: Sequence/ID generation with time-rotation
- @mbc-cqrs-serverless/task: Long-running task management
- @mbc-cqrs-serverless/tenant: Multi-tenancy support
- @mbc-cqrs-serverless/ui-setting: UI configuration management
- @mbc-cqrs-serverless/import: Data import module
- @mbc-cqrs-serverless/directory: Directory management

## Quick Start

```bash
# Install CLI globally
npm install -g @mbc-cqrs-serverless/cli

# Create new project
mbc new PROJECT_NAME -p npm
cd PROJECT_NAME

# Start local development
npm install
npm run build
npm run start:localstack
npm run offline
```

## Architecture Pattern

- Commands: State-changing write operations (CreateResourceCommand)
- Queries: Read-only operations
- Events: Domain events published after commands (ResourceCreatedEvent)
- Handlers: Business logic implementation (CreateResourceHandler)

## Module Structure

```
src/
├── controllers/     # REST/GraphQL endpoints
├── commands/        # Command handlers
├── queries/         # Query handlers
├── events/          # Event definitions
├── dto/             # Data transfer objects
├── entities/        # Domain entities
└── module.ts        # Module definition
```
